intro: Centaurea paniculata subsp. polycephala, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, globular inflorescence composed of numerous small, bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often arranged in a basal rosette. This subspecies is well adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
